conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with a square wire frame in a magnetic field.
Details about the wire frame's dimensions and magnetic field characteristics.
Frictional force must counteract magnetic force since the frame is stationary.
Induced emf is calculated using Faraday's law of induction.
Area of the wire frame within the magnetic field is calculated.
Correction of area calculation for the part of the frame in the magnetic field.
Magnetic flux through the area is calculated.
Rate of change of magnetic flux is determined.
Induced emf is calculated with a negative sign indicating opposition to flux change.
Induced current in the wire frame is calculated using Ohm's law.
Direction of the current is determined to oppose the change in magnetic flux.
Magnetic force on the wire frame is calculated using the current and magnetic field.
Description of the square labeled ABCD and magnetic field direction.
Determination of sides in the magnetic field and current direction.
Re-evaluation of the induced current direction using Lenz's law.
